page.title: 03TRANSPORT
page.content: There are no trunk or major roads passing through the area although the M6 motorway, opened in 1970, passes through the south west corner of the block. Orton village is situated at the crossroads of the B6260 road _ Kendal to Appleby in Westmorland _ and the B6261 road _ Kirkby Stephen to Shap. There are numerous other minor roads, serving the hamlets in the area, and many tracks and lanes leading to isolated farmsteads and cottages. Although the main west coast railway route passes through the area the nearest railway stations are at Oxenholme (12 miles south) and Penrith (14 miles north). Ribble Motor Services and Braithwaites of Tebay provide a public transport service to and from the area. Many workers use private cars.
